Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.5625), ending at (0, 0.5625). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.5625), ending at (0, 0). Extrude the sketch by 0.4687 units in the positive Z direction. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with Tapered Top Create a new coordinate system with no rotation, and a translation of (0.2812, 0.1875, 0.4687) units. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a circle centered at (0.0937, 0.0937) with a radius of 0.0937 units. Extrude the sketch by 0.1406 units in the positive Z direction. Part 3: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners Create a new coordinate system with a rotation of -90 degrees around the Z axis, and a translation of (0.2776, 0, 0.1219) units. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a hexagon by drawing six lines: 1. Line 1: Starting at (0, 0.0562), ending at (0.0974, 0). 2. Line 2: Starting at (0.0974, 0), ending at (0.1949, 0.0562). 3. Line 3: Starting at (0.1949, 0.0562), ending at (0.1949, 0.1687). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0.1949, 0.1687), ending at (0.0974, 0.225). 5. Line 5: Starting at (0.0974, 0.225), ending at (0, 0.1687). 6. Line 6: Starting at (0, 0.1687), ending at (0, 0.0562). Extrude the sketch by 0.0469 units in the negative Z direction. Final Shape: Rectangular Prism with Cylindrical Hole The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one side. The hole is centered and has a diameter equal to the width of the prism. The prism is placed against a white background. The prism measures 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.4687 units, while the cylindrical hole measures 0.1875 x 0.1875 x 0.1406 units.</description>
